result.execSummary:
The defendant Harold B Beverly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Harold B Beverly is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Harold B Beverly was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Harold B Beverly

Prior: 112 Wisconsin Street, Pardeeville, WI 53954
Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to county jail/hoc on 4-29-16; unpaid court obligations of $423.95 and supervision fees of $240
Defendant Harold B Beverly in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Benavides requested Huber. Court granted.

Defendant Harold B Beverly in court, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Corrections made to revocation paperwork. Sentencing statements made. Court sentenced defendant to nine months jail. Transfer to Dodge County Jail granted. Civil judgment entered in the amount of $443. Court granted 56 days jail credit.

Notice of Hearing filed 4/6/2016 for sentencing hearing on revocation 4/29/2016 09:00am Branch 1 mailed to Harold Beverly Dodge County Jail 216 W. Center St. Juneau WI 53039 returned as undeliverable. Envelope states, "Return to sender, inmate not here." Label on envelope states, "unable to forward/for review". Confirmed 4/15/16 that the Defendant is now at the Columbia County Jail. Notice of Hearing mailed to Columbia County Jail.
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus for Dodge County Detention Facility on 4/29/16 at 9:00 A.M.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
filed by Probation Agent Pam Charvat - by fax

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Harold B Beverly, appeared pro se. Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court went over the right to an attorney. Defendant waived attorney. Rights & elements recited. Defendant plead no contest to count 2 & 14TR7298. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld on ct. 2, 1 year probation, complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations, $443 costs. Court granted one day jail credit. Ct. 1 dismissed. On the OWI, $761.50 fine, 60 days to pay or payment plan with Clerk of Court, complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. 12 month IID, six month driver's license suspension.

Defendant, Harold B Beverly, appeared with Atty. Alicia Nall, special for public defender office. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $2,000 recog. bond with felony conds. Time limits waived.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 09:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
